hackathon-description-text: HackCU hosts the largest annual 36-hour hackathon in the Rocky Mountain region at the University of Colorado, Boulder.
hackathon-rules:
Ages 18+ only
Must be in college or graduated within one year (code school counts as college)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue Tablets and the first place medallions from MLH for each and every team member.
Second place medallions from MLH for each and every team member.
Third place medallions from MLH for each and every team member.
GitHub and MLH have partnered to award Octocat trophies to the best developer-related tool! It can be anything that eases the life/work-flow of software/hardware developers.
Register a free ".com", ".net", or ".org" domain using the MLH Domain cards and make it punny! Each member of the winning team gets a swag bag filled with all kinds of hacker goodies.
A sit-down with Jack Dorsey himself (Co-founder of Twitter) for all members of the winning team.
Use Amazon Alexa and make it fun, innovate, and interesting! Amazon Echos or a FireTV is the prize.
Hack out something with the Keysight API on the Photon/particle/spark boards

hackathon-description-header: The University of Colorado's Largest Hackathon
